title: Standard Validation Protocol for Opinion Dynamics Models: Metrics, Benchmarks, and Phase Transition Detection
summary: This comprehensive validation protocol synthesizes standard metrics, benchmarks, and phase transition detection approaches from 20+ peer-reviewed computational social science publications. Key findings: (1) Cluster stability uses smooth clustering metric c = 1/Σ(r_i²) with 20+ run validation; (2) Bounded confidence convergence requires mathematical conditions (self-confidence, symmetry, interior) with finite-time guarantees; (3) Phase transitions detected via critical slowing down (variance/autocorrelation peaks), bifurcation analysis with eigenvalue conditions, and early warning signals (multiplicative noise eliminates traditional EWS); (4) Standard networks: Watts-Strogatz p ∈ [0.1,0.25] optimal, Barabási-Albert α ∈ [2,3]; (5) Replication: 20+ runs, TSC ∈ [1,30] steps, |m|≤0.001 convergence slope; (6) Empirical validation requires BOTH macro R²>0.8 AND micro transition matrix D_micro matching. Provides actionable formulas, threshold values, and statistical testing protocols for opinion dynamics validation.
